instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not power on
threads.message:
Hello Everybody

Magsafe light is green and when battery charging orange but after hit power button orange turn green two second later turn orange not fan spin or anything.

No liquid damage,no drop

When measure

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.5V ( when hit power button its start to down until 2v, magsafe cable unplug&plug its turn 12.5V again)
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP09_S5</SIGNAL>= 0.9V

I think sort to ground any of S0 rails but didnt find

Where can i start to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not power on
threads.message:
Something is pulling down PPBUS. Hard to tell which rail it is. First check all coils for shorts to GND.
Also power on with KBD disconnected and using the pads on the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not power on
threads.message:
When checked coils <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> line is shorted ground. I found damaged <CAPACITOR>C6213</CAPACITOR> shorted ground after replacement solved problem

Thank you Duke
